body.p:
Hickman Ky May 31st 1861
To his excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Respected sir

At the present Term of this court Mr J. W. Clark was fined $60 -- for Keeping a tippling house the evidence showed that Mr Clark had always Kept ash an orderly house and always obtained a license so to do -- but because th his bar room was not under the same rofof of his hotel. The Jury was bound to find him guilty. Mr Clark is a good law abiding citizen and would not Knowingly violate any law -- and as he is poore and as he did not Know that he was violating any law he asks your excellency to remit the find

your obedient servant
Thos. H Corbett
